title: [Self-Directed] Sustainability and Organizational Learning: Developing Integrated Strategies Through Mathematical Modeling (Equations, Statistics, and Simulation)

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematical knowledge (algebra, statistics, calculus, matrix operations), understanding of organizational management concepts, foundational grasp of sustainability principles, and graph interpretation skills
context.additional_context: Mobile learning environment optimization for smartphones, analyzing sustainable management strategies using mathematical tools (matrix operations, probability models, optimization algorithms). Requires simulation and statistical analysis based on real data using programming tools like R/Python during learning.

learning_goals: Learners can represent the three pillars of sustainability (economic, environmental, social) using linear/nonlinear equations and design multivariate analysis models utilizing matrix operations.

Within six months, learners can construct at least three multiple regression models to analyze the correlation between organizational learning mechanisms (knowledge-sharing frequency, training participation rates) and sustainability performance (energy efficiency improvement, carbon emission reduction), and submit a report verifying statistical significance at p-value < 0.05.

Applying critical thinking, learners can validate corporate sustainability strategy improvements through differential equation-based simulations and derive feasible solutions using optimization algorithms.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
